name: Last-Child
description:
The `:last-child` pseudo-class will match the last child element of of its parent element. It's also the same as `:nth-last-child(1)`.
[info]This pseudo-class is part of the CSS3 specification while its "opposite" selector [`:first-child`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css2/structural-pseudo-class/ 'CSS2: Structural pseudo class') is part of CSS2.[/info]
example_description: This example code will select just the last element in the list of children of its parent element.
